citations.narrative:
On January 14, 2024, forty adult parakeets escaped through a hole in the top of the black mesh enclosing the aviary. The
birds were not recovered. The hole was formed because of a tear in the black mesh from adverse weather that was
experienced that week, whereby the structures and materials used to enclose the aviary were meant to be in place
temporarily. Inadequate construction and maintenance of a primary enclosure can negatively impact the health, safety
and well-being of the animals enclosed therein. Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable
materials so that they are structurally sound, kept in good repair, and must be constructed and maintained so that they
contain the birds securely. The facility made temporary repairs to the mesh and other areas that were damaged and are in
the process of making plans for permanent repairs soon. The remaining forty parakeets are being temporarily housed
indoors/off-exhibit until the repairs are completed.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
